alert.note: Alert for Scott (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 4:31PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Greene, Hawkins, Sullivan and Washington. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Scott. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johnson City, Kingsport, Rogersville, Jonesborough, Surgoinsville, Colonial Heights, Gray, Spurgeon, Oak Grove, Church Hill, Mount Carmel, Baileyton, Fall Branch, Bays Mountain Park, Sullivan Gardens, Jearoldstown, Leesburg, Warriors Path State Park, Limestone and Telford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
